page.title: 20Population.
page.content: Our block is quite thinly populated compared to a town or city block. The biggest village is Uley,which has 1500 people in 1985. This population is currently falling. About 100 years ago a lot of people lived in the area,because of the work generated by the booming woollen industry. When it collapsed many people left the area to find work in the towns and cities. The population has steadily declined since then. Uley is a middle class village,with many people in the "professions". Houses are very expensive and young people usually cannot afford to buy them.Therefore the average age in the village is getting older all the time. Young families mainly live in council housing. The Parish Council is pressing for housing for young people in the area to prevent this decline.
